ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sauté until softened.
Add ground beef, breaking it up with a spoon, and cook until browned. Drain excess fat if necessary.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.

In a large baking dish, spread a thin layer of the meat sauce. Layer with lasagna noodles, ricotta mixture, and meat sauce, repeating until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of meat sauce.
Sprinkle remaining shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until bubbly and cheese is melted and lightly browned.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 4 cups chicken or vegetable broth, heated
8 oz mushrooms (such as cremini or shiitake), sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: In a large skillet or pan, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sauté until softened and translucent.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their juices and become tender.
Add Arborio rice to the skillet, stirring constantly for about 1-2 minutes until rice is lightly toasted.
Pour in white wine and cook until it has been absorbed by the rice, stirring frequently.
Begin adding hot broth to the rice mixture, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
Continue this process until the rice is creamy and tender, but still slightly firm to the bite (al dente). This will take about 20-25 minutes.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and remaining tablespoon of butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
In a shallow dish, combine cooled brewed coffee and coffee liqueur (if using).
In a mixing bowl, beat egg yolks and 3/4 cup granulated sugar until pale and creamy.
Add mascarpone cheese and vanilla extract, beat until smooth and creamy.
In another mixing bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold beaten egg whites into the mascarpone mixture until well combined.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger cookie into the coffee mixture, turning to coat both sides but not soaking.
Arrange a layer of dipped ladyfingers in the bottom of a serving dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and remaining mascarpone mixture.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight to set.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder using a fine-mesh sieve.
